dimensions: h. 8.1 cm., diam. rim 4.3 cm., max. diam. 5.2 cm. (3 3/16 x 1 11/16 x 2 1/16 in.)
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Straka

texts.textentryhtml: In-folded, tubular rim; flaring mouth; short cylindrical neck, strongly constricted at its base; spherical body; flat base. On the body are three mold-blown rows of herringbone pattern. Blown into a bipartite mold. At the center of the bottom is an annular pontil mark, 1.6 cm. wide
Given to the Museum by Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Straka

Egyptian, Coptic, Neolithic, Italic, Etruscan, Greek, Roman, Norse-Viking, Western Asiatic, Islamic antiquities: the property of various owners, including the Hagop Kevorkian Fund ... [et al.]: public auction, December 1 [1972] New York Galleries of Sotheby Parke Bernet Inc., (New York: Sotheby Parke Bernet Inc., 1972).

, No. 162a, from Cranbrook Academy of Arts, Bloomfield Hills, Michigan. Solid for $80. Description fits 84-9 and Mr. Straka bought no. 162; 84-9 seems to have been on the market, for it has the remains of the fine purple string used for the tiny labels on which dealers (but not SPB) made their notations.
